intro: Knema, commonly known as the "false toon," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. These plants are native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and Malaysia. Knema species are typically small to medium-sized trees or shrubs, often found in lowland and hill forest ecosystems. They are characterized by their aromatic leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The fruits are usually small, woody capsules that contain several seeds.
